selection_rationale: In large-N, high-d settings, the subspace rank directly trades optimization capacity for communication cost; stepsize governs stability/speed under higher dimensionality; momentum smooths client-gradient variance across many clients.

configs.rationale: Moderate rank reduction to cut comm; slightly lower LR to stabilize high-d updates while preserving speed.
Aggressive comm reduction via tight subspace; baseline momentum with moderate LR to maintain accuracy.
Higher rank for capacity; lower LR + higher momentum to ensure smooth convergence at d=1024.
Faster steps with reduced momentum to avoid overshoot; tests speed-vs-stability at the scenario’s default rank.
Low-rank to lower comm; higher momentum to compensate capacity reduction, keeping LR moderate.
Larger rank for maximum accuracy; conservative LR to handle high-d gradients without instability.
Moderate rank with faster LR to speed convergence; baseline momentum for smoothing with many clients.
Minimum comm setting; conservative LR and momentum to maintain stability with tight projection.

expected_improvement: Compared to the baseline SFedAvg in this scenario, expect 30–50% lower cumulative communication (via smaller ranks) while matching or slightly improving test accuracy, and smoother convergence through tuned stepsize/momentum.
